engine
Class Collisions

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--engine.Collisions
public final class Collisions
extends java.lang.Object

Collisions - Handles the processing of collisions - cannot be subclasses because it is written in a very C like structure as to maximize on Java performance Everything is static for memory efficiency and time efficiency. Only one instance of the Collisions class can exist at any given runtime. It is assumed that a ball can only collide with one object at any given time.

Author:
Ragu Vijaykumar

Nested Class Summary
static class Collisions.CollisionInfo
          CollisionInfo - Holds all information related to a collision that needs to be processed by the engine - all information regarding collision should be accessed in a static way, with no worry as to manipulation of data
static class Collisions.CollisionIterator
          CollisionIterator - operates in much the same manner as an iterator, without a remove method however.

public static Collisions initialize(int initialCapacity,
                                    float loadFactor)
Initializes this with the following information. Only one instance can exist at any given time

Parameters:
initialCapacity - - number of collisions expected
loadFactor - - what percentage of the capacity should the size increase

isPresent

public boolean isPresent(BallPhysics ball,
                         PiecePhysics piece)
Checks to see if there is already a collision between this ball and piece

Parameters:
ball - - ball involved in collision
piece - - piece involved in collision
Returns:
true iff there is a collision between the ball and the piece

setMinCollision

public void setMinCollision(BallPhysics ball,
                            Physics3dObject ballShape,
                            PiecePhysics piece,
                            Physics3dObject pieceShape)
Sets the collision that is going to happen in the fastest amount of time This method should be expected to take O(1) time.

Parameters:
ball - - ball involved in collision
ballShape - - physics3d object that is part of the ball that is involved in collision
piece - - piece involved in collision
pieceShape - - physics3d object that is part of the piece that is involved in collision
